pregunta: 3. What is the recommended approach for patients with RMD who are taking rituximab in terms of timing non-live attenuated vaccine administration relative to the next dose of medication?
respuesta: For patients with rheumatic and musculoskeletal diseases (RMD) who are taking rituximab, it is conditionally recommended to defer non-live attenuated vaccinations, with the exception of the influenza vaccination, until the next rituximab administration is due. Additionally, it is recommended to delay rituximab for 2 weeks after vaccination to maximize vaccine efficacy. This approach is based on the need to optimize immunization responses while managing the timing of rituximab treatments.

pregunta: 10. Is there a difference in the seroconversion rates between younger patients with rheumatoid arthritis receiving high-dose influenza vaccination compared to standard-dose vaccination?
respuesta: Yes, based on the provided information, two randomized controlled trials (RCTs) in rheumatoid arthritis (RA) patients showed that younger patients receiving high-dose influenza vaccination had higher seroconversion rates compared to those receiving standard-dose vaccination. There was no safety signal observed, indicating that the high-dose vaccine was well-tolerated.
